summary: This is an internal FBI email from the New York office scheduling a briefing for the Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) on the Nygard case. It requests preparation of a written case summary and provides two example documents as guides, indicating coordination within the Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad.

persons.name: Nygard
persons.context: The email is about scheduling an ADIC briefing on the 'Nygard case,' indicating he is the central subject of an FBI investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: His name appears in the title of one of the attached example documents ('VCS.JeffreyEpstein_NY.06282019.docx'), suggesting his case is being used as a reference or template for the Nygard briefing.

persons.name: Ray
persons.role: Possibly a case agent or subject
persons.context: The name appears in the title of the other attached document ('Ray_Case_update_1.16.20.docx'), which is provided as an example for the briefing format.

connections.description: The Nygard case briefing is being prepared using a document about the Jeffrey Epstein case as a format guide, suggesting the FBI views or handles the investigations similarly.

events.title: Scheduled ADIC briefing on Nygard case
events.description: A briefing for the Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) on the Nygard case is tentatively scheduled.

keyFacts: The FBI's New York Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad (C-20) was actively investigating the 'Nygard case' as of January 2020.
The briefing preparation involved using existing case documents on Jeffrey Epstein and another 'Ray' case as templates, indicating procedural parallels.
The email shows internal FBI coordination for high-level briefings, with a focus on outlining case background, developments, strategy, and potential charges.
